Alarm.Description: Alarm is triggered (with Text containing the list of errors) when some node of the component (like operator) has configuration fault.
Alarm.Name: ConfigurationFaults

Operator.Description: MQTT Publisher Sequencer block to publish data to the MQTT network via Publish events. Has to be connected to a MQTTClient, via the MQTTClient connector.
Operator.Name: Publisher

ArgumentMessage.Description: Will be emitted when MQTTClient has established the connection with the configured broker
ArgumentMessage.Name: Connected

ArgumentMessage.Description: Will be emitted when MQTTClient has lost the connection with the configured broker
ArgumentMessage.Name: Disconnected

ArgumentMessage.Description: Invokes publishing of Payload data to the Topic. Can contain other Arguments that modify the MQTT publishing behavior.
ArgumentMessage.Name: Publish

ArgumentMessage.Description: Will be emitted when MQTTClient has successfully published the data from Publish event. Will contain all the arguments of the original Publish event plus a MessageID argument.
ArgumentMessage.Name: Published

ArgumentMessage.Description: Will be emitted when MQTTClient was not able to publish the data from Publish event. Will contain all the arguments of the original Publish event plus an Error argument.
ArgumentMessage.Name: PublishFailed

Argument.Description: MQTT topic string for the message to be published
Argument.Name: Topic

Argument.Description: Payload to publish to the Topic
Argument.Name: Payload

Argument.Description: Quality of service level of broker communication
Argument.Name: QoS

Argument.Description: Defines if the broker should retain last message sent. If true, for any new subscriber on this topic, retained message will be sent immediately.
Argument.Name: Retain

Argument.Description: Generate MQTT v5 topic alias on first publish to save network traffic on consequent sends when the same Topic string is used. Can be used only when MQTTClient ProtocolVersion is set to v5 (or higher) and the broker also supports MQTT v5 (or higher).
Argument.Name: AutoAlias

Argument.Description: When filled, indicates a topic that the request publisher expects the response to be published to. Can be used only when MQTTClient ProtocolVersion is set to v5 (or higher) and the broker also supports MQTT v5 (or higher).
Argument.Name: ResponseTopic

Argument.Description: When filled, identifies the specific request and should be echoed back by repsonder when it responds to ResponseTopic. Can be used only when MQTTClient ProtocolVersion is set to v5 (or higher) and the broker also supports MQTT v5 (or higher).
Argument.Name: CorrelationData

Argument.Description: On successful publish (Published event), contains MQTT message ID of the outgoing message. Message ID is available when QoS > 0.
Argument.Name: MessageID

Argument.Description: On failure (PublishFailed event), contains the error message describing the failure reason
Argument.Name: Error

Client.Description: Connector to the MQTTClient object, which will provide the MQTT functionality for the block (via RPC messaging). Can be connected also via the MQTTClientRPC router block(s).
Client.Name: MQTTClient

Parameter.Description: Parameter that will be stored to disk outside of CDP. Will make the parameter persistent even with an Overwrite deploy.
Parameter.Name: Width

Parameter.Description: Parameter that will be stored to disk outside of CDP. Will make the parameter persistent even with an Overwrite deploy.
Parameter.Name: Height

Parameter.Description: Parameter that will be stored to disk outside of CDP. Will make the parameter persistent even with an Overwrite deploy.
Parameter.Name: Framerate
